channel.title: Connection Error - Trying Again in 5...4....3....2..1.......10
channel.description: Ok, I got a new source that was actually simple enough for me (I'm a new coder and I want to get used to stuff instead of being confused going through bin files and stuff like that. Well, I changed the IP and it actually worked. It says it's online. I am not sure if this is an anti-leech, but when I download the client from a different computer and click run, it goes "Connection Error - Trying Again in 5...4....3....2..1.......10.........." an increased by 5 everytime. I do not know what this is. Does anybody else know?

item.title: Connection Error - Trying Again in 5...4....3....2..1.......10
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:5, topic:339106”]its your client, its not using the same uid as the server is requesting, causing you unable to get on

and that 5-1 10-1 error, means ur cache is corrupt[/quote]
so how do I fix my cache?

I’m pretty sure I portforwarded right. My computer guy actually came over and did it for me.
It worked fine before :mad:
Modem:

Bellsouth.jpg1022×766

Router:
netgear.jpg1024×768

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Error - Trying Again in 5...4....3....2..1.......10
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

its your client, its not using the same uid as the server is requesting, causing you unable to get on

and that 5-1 10-1 error, means ur cache is corrupt

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Error - Trying Again in 5...4....3....2..1.......10
item.dc:creator: @iamapker iamapker
item.description:
@iamapker wrote:

well you are not able to connect to your server by entering your ip, it just doesnt work, now as for your friend he must enter your ip and you must make suer your no-ip it set up correctly is turned on and is up-to-date also that you portforwared correctly so people can connect to you, to check this go to http://canyouseeme.org/ and type in 43594 then press “check” please post all results here so i may continue helping you, also post if it works.

GoodLuck!

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Error - Trying Again in 5...4....3....2..1.......10
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

Well, the Connection Error - Trying Again in 5…4…3…2…1…10… was from my friend’s computer. Not mine. I can login fine…but…:

127001.jpg1024×768

My server is running, but for me it runs on 127.0.0.1
When I run on tormentedmemories.no-ip.biz (my ip) it says this:
tormentedmemoriesno-ipbiz.jpg1024×768

my client on my computer does not do the Connection Error thing. It was on my friends computer. It was even him logging in; it was him loading the client. I barely did any customization yet because I can’t figure this problem out perhaps this is some sort of anti-leech? cuz if so, idk how to fix cuz i’m a new coder I just want a simple server that me and my friends can pk on but any source I find always screws up for me -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Error - Trying Again in 5...4....3....2..1.......10
item.dc:creator: @iamapker iamapker
item.description:
@iamapker wrote:

did you change the ip inside the client to 127.0.0.1 so you can connect to your own server? its most likely found in GUI or EGUI just find “server Ip” in there and change it to that so somehow it comes out to be

Serverip = "127.0.0.1";

or

Serverip = "";

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Error - Trying Again in 5...4....3....2..1.......10
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

Ok, I got a new source that was actually simple enough for me (I’m a new coder and I want to get used to stuff instead of being confused going through bin files and stuff like that. Well, I changed the IP and it actually worked. It says it’s online. I am not sure if this is an anti-leech, but when I download the client from a different computer and click run, it goes “Connection Error - Trying Again in 5…4…3…2…1…10…” an increased by 5 everytime. I do not know what this is. Does anybody else know?
